meanings.definition: A person or thing that unifies or brings together different elements.
meanings.sent1: The team captain acted as the unifier, bringing together players from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent2: The family photo album served as a unifier, reminding everyone of shared memories.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle was a tricky unifier, as everyone had to work together to find the missing pieces.
meanings.sent4: Music can be a powerful unifier, harmonizing people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow was a beautiful unifier, blending all the colors seamlessly.

meanings.definition: A software or device that combines different systems or components into a single unit.
meanings.sent1: The new app acted as a unifier, integrating various functions into one easy-to-use platform.
meanings.sent2: The universal remote control is a convenient unifier for managing multiple devices.
meanings.sent3: The smart thermostat proved to be a helpful unifier, controlling both the heating and cooling systems.
meanings.sent4: The translator app is a digital unifier, bridging the language barrier between people.
meanings.sent5: The USB hub is a practical unifier, connecting all your devices to one central port.
